None / Ultrasound (if organ enlargement suspected) Peripheral Blood Smear, Rapid Antigen Test (RDT)
Abdominal Ultrasound (sometimes) Blood Culture (gold standard), Widal Test, Typhidot Metformin 500mg Once or twice daily Long-term Oral Monitor blood glucose and kidney function
Chest X-Ray (for opportunistic infections) HIV ELISA/4th gen, CD4 count, Viral Load Erythropoietin 4000 IU Once weekly Long-term Subcutaneous Also add ACE inhibitor for BP control
Chest X-Ray, HRCT Chest (if needed) Sputum AFB smear, GeneXpert (CBNAAT), TB culture Ceftriaxone 1g + Metronidazole 500mg Every 12 hours Pre- and post-surgery IV Preoperative antibiotic prophylaxis
Upper GI Endoscopy H. pylori testing (Urea breath test, Stool antigen, Biopsy) Ursodeoxycholic acid 300mg Once daily 6�12 months Oral Helps dissolve cholesterol stones
Chest X-Ray, Chest CT if severe Sputum Gram stain & Culture, Blood culture, Procalcitonin Analgesics (Tramadol 50mg) Every 8 hours As needed IV or Oral Supportive therapy; IV fluids essential
Fundus Photography (retinopathy screening) HbA1c, Fasting Blood Sugar, Oral Glucose Tolerance Test Aspirin 150mg Once daily Long-term Oral Add Atorvastatin 40mg for secondary prevention
Echocardiography (when indicated) Basic Metabolic Panel, Lipid Profile, Kidney Function Tests Aspirin 150mg + Clopidogrel 75mg Once daily Long-term Oral Add Atorvastatin and Beta-blocker
Ultrasound Abdomen/Kidneys Serum Creatinine, eGFR, Urine Analysis (ACR) Salbutamol 100mcg 2 puffs as needed As needed Inhalation Rescue inhaler for bronchospasm
Ultrasound Abdomen (plasma leak in severe cases) Dengue NS1 antigen, IgM/IgG serology, Platelet count Tiotropium 18mcg capsule Once daily Long-term Inhalation Maintenance bronchodilator
Ultrasound Abdomen (liver size/other causes) HAV IgM Loratadine 10mg Once daily As needed Oral Non-sedating antihistamine
Ultrasound Abdomen (liver assessment), FibroScan HBsAg, HBV DNA, LFTs Amoxicillin 500mg Every 8 hours 7 days Oral First-line antibiotic
Ultrasound Abdomen, FibroScan HCV antibody, HCV RNA (PCR), LFTs Ciprofloxacin 0.3% drops 1�2 drops every 4 hours 5�7 days Ophthalmic Antibacterial eye drops
Ultrasound Kidney/Bladder (recurrent/complicated) Urine Routine, Urine Culture & Sensitivity Methotrexate 15mg Once weekly Long-term Oral or Subcutaneous Folic acid supplement needed
Abdominal Ultrasound (CT abdomen if unclear) CBC (elevated WBC), CRP Allopurinol 100mg Once daily Long-term Oral Start after acute attack subsides
Ultrasound Abdomen (RUQ) Liver Function Tests, Amylase/Lipase if pancreatitis suspected Gluten-free diet   Lifelong Dietary No pharmacologic treatment
Abdominal Ultrasound, CT Abdomen (severity) Serum Amylase, Lipase, LFTs Dicyclomine 20mg Three times daily As needed Oral Antispasmodic for cramping
CT Head (non-contrast), MRI Brain (diffusion) Blood glucose, CBC, Electrolytes, Coagulation profile Mesalamine 800mg Three times daily Long-term Oral or Rectal For mild to moderate UC
ECG, Echocardiography Troponin I/T, CK-MB, Lipid profile Vancomycin 1g + Gentamicin 1mg/kg Every 12 hours 4�6 weeks IV Adjust per culture results
Chest X-Ray (to rule out complications) Spirometry, Peak flow, Allergy tests if needed Piperacillin-Tazobactam 4.5g Every 6 hours 7�14 days IV Broad-spectrum empiric therapy

Chest X-Ray, CT Chest (if emphysema/complications) Spirometry (post-bronchodilator), Alpha-1 antitrypsin if young Ceftriaxone 2g + Dexamethasone 10mg Every 12 hours 7�14 days IV Empiric bacterial meningitis coverage
Sinus X-Ray or CT if chronic/sinusitis suspected Allergy skin testing, Specific IgE Acyclovir 10mg/kg Every 8 hours 14�21 days IV For suspected HSV encephalitis
Tympanometry (ENT exam) None routine; culture if discharge (ear swab) Flucloxacillin 500mg Every 6 hours 7�10 days Oral If severe�switch to IV
None usually Conjunctival swab culture (if bacterial suspicion) Acyclovir 400mg Three times daily 7�10 days Oral Topical cream can also be used
Sinus X-Ray or CT Sinuses (chronic/complicated) Nasal swab/culture if chronic Remdesivir 200mg (day 1) Once daily 5 days IV Add Dexamethasone 6mg daily if severe
X-Ray of affected joint No specific lab test; ESR/CRP to rule out inflammatory causes Oseltamivir 75mg Every 12 hours 5 days Oral Start within 48 hours of symptom onset
X-Ray, Ultrasound/MRI of joints RF, Anti-CCP (ACPA), ESR, CRP Azithromycin 250mg Once daily 3�6 months Oral Long-term prophylaxis in chronic cases

X-Ray (chronic), Ultrasound (double contour sign) Serum uric acid, Synovial fluid analysis (MSU crystals) Heparin 5000 IU Every 12 hours 5�7 days (then Warfarin) IV/Subcutaneous Bridge to oral anticoagulant
Neck Ultrasound if nodules suspected TSH, Free T4, Anti-TPO antibodies Enoxaparin 1mg/kg Every 12 hours 5�10 days Subcutaneous Then switch to Apixaban or Warfarin
Thyroid uptake scan (nuclear), Ultrasound TSH, Free T4/T3, TSH receptor antibodies Folic Acid 5mg Once daily Throughout pregnancy Oral Also add Iron 100mg/day
None routine (endoscopy if needed) tTG-IgA, Total IgA, Duodenal biopsy (gold standard) Labetalol 100mg Every 8 hours Until delivery Oral Add Magnesium sulfate for seizure prevention
Abdominal imaging only if alarm features Basic labs to exclude other causes (CBC, CRP) Methotrexate 50mg/m� Single dose One-time IM Monitor ?-hCG levels
CT/MR Enterography, Colonoscopy Fecal calprotectin, CBC, CRP, Stool studies Alendronate 70mg Once weekly Long-term Oral Take on empty stomach with water
Echocardiography (TTE/TEE) Blood cultures (multiple sets), CBC, ESR/CRP Cholecalciferol 60 000 IU Once weekly 6�8 weeks Oral Then maintenance monthly
Appropriate imaging per source (X-Ray/US/CT) Blood cultures, CBC, Lactate, Procalcitonin Cyanocobalamin 1000mcg Once daily (1 week) then monthly Maintenance IM or Oral Depends on cause
CT Head (before LP if indicated) CSF analysis (cell count, glucose, protein), CSF culture, PCR panels Thiamine 100mg Once daily Long-term Oral Abstinence from alcohol is essential
MRI Brain CSF analysis, PCR for HSV/VZV, Autoimmune panels as indicated Pioglitazone 15mg Once daily Long-term Oral Plus weight loss & exercise
Ultrasound if abscess suspected Wound swab culture if purulent Spironolactone 100mg + Furosemide 40mg Once daily Long-term Oral Monitor potassium levels
None usually PCR from lesion, Viral culture, Serology (limited) Tamsulosin 0.4mg Once daily Up to 4 weeks Oral Alpha blocker for stone passage
Chest X-Ray, Chest CT for severe disease SARS-CoV-2 PCR (nasopharyngeal), Rapid antigen tests Metformin 500mg Once or twice daily Long-term Oral Add combined oral contraceptive if needed
Chest X-Ray if lower respiratory involvement Influenza PCR or Rapid antigen test Leuprolide 3.75mg Once monthly 3�6 months IM GnRH agonist therapy
High-resolution CT Chest (HRCT) Sputum culture (including mycobacteria), AFB if TB suspected Clomiphene citrate 50mg Once daily (Day 2�6 cycle) 5 days Oral Induces ovulation
CT Pulmonary Angiography (CTPA), V/Q scan D-dimer, ABG, Leg Doppler for DVT Leuprolide 3.75mg Once monthly Long-term IM Androgen deprivation therapy
Venous Doppler Ultrasound (lower limb) D-dimer, Coagulation profile Tamoxifen 20mg Once daily 5 years Oral For ER-positive breast cancer
Obstetric Ultrasound (dating/anomaly) Blood group & Rh, CBC, RPR/VDRL, Hepatitis B/C, HIV, Urine routine Cisplatin 75mg/m� + Pemetrexed 500mg/m� Every 3 weeks Varies IV Platinum-based regimen
Obstetric Ultrasound (growth scan) Urine protein:creatinine ratio, LFTs, Platelet count, Serum creatinine 5-Fluorouracil 400mg/m� + Oxaliplatin 85mg/m� Every 2 weeks 6 months IV FOLFOX regimen
Transvaginal Ultrasound Serial beta-hCG Cisplatin 40mg/m� Once weekly 6 weeks IV Concurrent with radiation
DEXA Scan (Bone mineral density) Serum Calcium, Vitamin D, PTH Imatinib 400mg Once daily Long-term Oral For CML (BCR-ABL positive)

None routine imaging 25-hydroxy Vitamin D level, Calcium, Phosphate CHOP regimen (Cyclophosphamide + Doxorubicin + Vincristine + Prednisone) Cycle every 21 days 6�8 cycles IV Standard first-line for DLBCL
MRI brain/spine if neurological signs Serum B12, Methylmalonic acid, CBC Levodopa + Carbidopa 100/25mg Three times daily Long-term Oral Mainstay therapy for motor symptoms
Ultrasound Abdomen, FibroScan LFTs, GGT, CDT, Viral hepatitis serology to exclude others Donepezil 10mg Once daily Long-term Oral Cholinesterase inhibitor; improves cognition
Ultrasound Abdomen, FibroScan LFTs, Lipid profile, HbA1c Lithium 300mg Two to three times daily Long-term Oral Monitor renal and thyroid function
Ultrasound Abdomen, CT/MRI Liver LFTs, INR, Platelet count, Ascitic fluid analysis if present Risperidone 2�4mg Once daily Long-term Oral Atypical antipsychotic; monitor metabolic side effects
Non-contrast CT KUB, Ultrasound (pregnancy) Urine Analysis, Stone analysis, Serum calcium/uric acid Ferrous sulfate 325mg Three times daily 3 months Oral Take with vitamin C for better absorption
Pelvic Ultrasound (ovarian morphology) Serum LH/FSH, Testosterone, HbA1c, Lipid profile Hydroxyurea 500mg Once daily Long-term Oral Increases fetal hemoglobin; reduces crises
Transvaginal Ultrasound, MRI pelvis (selected cases) Laparoscopy (visualization & biopsy) Folic acid 5mg Once daily Long-term Oral Regular transfusions may be required
Hysterosalpingography (HSG), Pelvic US Hormonal panel (FSH, LH, AMH, Prolactin), Semen analysis for partner Methotrexate 15mg Once weekly Long-term Oral or IM Monitor liver function
Multiparametric MRI Prostate PSA, Transrectal biopsy (histopathology) Hydrocortisone 1% cream Apply twice daily 7�14 days Topical Relieves itching and inflammation
Mammography, Breast Ultrasound, MRI if indicated Core needle biopsy, ER/PR/HER2 testing Amoxicillin-Clavulanate 875/125mg Every 12 hours 7�10 days Oral or IV Add drainage if abscess present
CT Chest, PET-CT for staging Sputum cytology (limited), Biopsy (bronchoscopic or CT-guided) Supportive therapy  As needed Symptomatic Rest and hydration; no antiviral needed
CT Colonography, Colonoscopy Colonoscopy biopsy, CEA tumor marker Benzathine Penicillin G 2.4 million units Single dose One-time IM For early syphilis; weekly �3 for late
Pelvic Ultrasound, MRI pelvis for staging Pap smear (screening), HPV testing, Biopsy Imiquimod 5% cream Apply three times weekly Up to 16 weeks Topical For external genital warts

None specific imaging except organomegaly (US/CT) CBC with peripheral smear, Bone marrow aspiration & biopsy, Flow cytometry Remdesivir + Dexamethasone 200mg day 1 then 100mg daily 5�10 days IV Supportive oxygen as needed
CT Neck/Chest/Abdomen/Pelvis, PET-CT Excisional lymph node biopsy, Immunohistochemistry, Flow cytometry Multivitamins + Physiotherapy  Long-term Supportive Symptom management only
MRI Brain (to exclude other causes) Mostly clinical; DaTscan (SPECT) in select cases Benzathine Penicillin G 1.2 million units Every 3 weeks Long-term prophylaxis IM Add Aspirin for joint pain
MRI Brain Cognitive testing; CSF biomarkers (amyloid/tau) in specialized settings Ibuprofen 400mg Every 8 hours 1�2 weeks Oral Add Colchicine 0.5mg daily
MRI Brain (epilepsy protocol) EEG, Metabolic workup as needed Ketoconazole 200mg Two times daily Variable Oral Used to suppress cortisol
None usually No specific pathology tests; neuroimaging only for red flags Hydrocortisone 20mg AM + 10mg PM Daily Long-term Oral Add fludrocortisone 0.1mg if needed
None routine imaging Clinical assessment; thyroid function and CBC to rule out organic causes Epinephrine 0.3mg Repeat every 5�15 min if needed Acute IM Use autoinjector (EpiPen)
None routine imaging Clinical assessment; labs to exclude secondary causes Warfarin 5mg Once daily Long-term Oral Maintain INR 2�3
None routine imaging Clinical assessment; occasional imaging if atypical features Spironolactone + Furosemide 100/40mg Once daily Long-term Oral Monitor electrolytes
None routine imaging CBC, Serum ferritin, Iron studies Aspirin 150mg Once daily Long-term Oral Secondary prevention with Atorvastatin
X-Rays for bone infarcts, Transcranial Doppler (pediatric stroke risk) Hemoglobin electrophoresis, CBC Dexamethasone 4mg Every 6 hours Variable Oral/IV Reduce edema pre-surgery
X-Ray (bone changes), Ultrasound Abdomen (splenomegaly) Hemoglobin electrophoresis, CBC Interferon beta-1a 44mcg Three times weekly Long-term Subcutaneous Immunomodulatory therapy
None routine imaging Mostly clinical; biopsy if diagnostic uncertainty Gemcitabine + Cisplatin 1000mg/m� + 25mg/m� Every 3 weeks 6 cycles IV Standard chemotherapy
None Mostly clinical; patch testing for contact dermatitis Combined oral contraceptive  Daily 3�6 months Oral Regulates menstrual cycle
Ultrasound to detect abscess Wound swab culture if purulent Metformin + Oral contraceptive 500mg BID Long-term Oral Improves insulin resistance
Ultrasound Abdomen HEV IgM, HEV RNA (PCR) Levothyroxine 50�100mcg Once daily Lifelong Oral Adjust dose per TSH levels
None routine imaging VDRL/RPR, TPPA/FTA-ABS confirmatory Omeprazole 20mg Once daily 4�8 weeks Oral PPI therapy for symptom relief
None routine imaging HPV DNA testing (cervical samples), Pap smear Pioglitazone + Vitamin E 15mg daily Long-term Oral Lifestyle modification essential
High-resolution CT Chest (if persistent breathlessness) SARS-CoV-2 PCR or serology (historical) Tamsulosin 0.4mg + Pain relief Once daily Up to 4 weeks Oral Hydration encouraged
Echocardiography ASO titer, ESR/CRP, Throat culture Omeprazole + Amoxicillin + Clarithromycin 20mg/1g/500mg 14 days Oral H. pylori eradication triple therapy
ECG, Echocardiography ESR/CRP, Cardiac enzymes if myocardial involvement Mannitol + Amlodipine Varies Hospital course IV/Oral Supportive neurocritical management
MRI Pituitary/CT abdomen (adrenal) 24-hour urinary cortisol, Low-dose dexamethasone suppression test Diosmin + Hydrocortisone cream 500mg BID 1�2 weeks Oral/Topical Sitz baths and diet control
CT Abdomen (adrenal atrophy/enlargement) AM Cortisol, ACTH stimulation test Paracetamol 500mg + Diclofenac 50mg Every 8 hours As needed Oral Add physiotherapy
None routine imaging Tryptase (post-event), Allergy testing later Betahistine 16mg Three times daily 2�4 weeks Oral Vestibular exercises helpful
Doppler ultrasound for thrombosis Lupus anticoagulant, Anti-cardiolipin, Beta-2 glycoprotein I Acyclovir 400mg Three times daily 7�10 days Oral/Topical For recurrent lesions
Chest X-Ray Sputum Culture Supportive + ACE inhibitors  As needed Oral/IV No specific antiviral
Chest CT Scan AFB Smear Test Riluzole 50mg Every 12 hours Long-term Oral Slows progression
Abdominal Ultrasound HbA1c Aspirin + Clopidogrel + Atorvastatin 150mg/75mg/40mg Once daily Long-term Oral Add Beta-blocker
Echocardiogram Serum Creatinine Pilocarpine 5mg Three times daily Long-term Oral Stimulates saliva production
Renal Ultrasound Urine Albumin Methotrexate 10mg Once weekly Long-term Oral/SC Symptom control only
Liver Ultrasound Liver Function Test Prednisolone 40mg Once daily Variable Oral Taper gradually
Abdominal Ultrasound Bilirubin Test Clomiphene citrate 25mg Once daily 3 months Oral Improves testosterone and sperm count
Abdominal CT Scan Serum Amylase Acyclovir cream 5% Apply 5 times daily 7 days Topical For HSV or varicella lesions
Chest X-Ray IgE Test Spironolactone + Furosemide 100/40mg Once daily Long-term Oral Monitor liver and renal function
Spirometry Arterial Blood Gas Prednisolone 40mg + Azathioprine 50mg Once daily Long-term Oral Gradual tapering
No Radiology Complete Blood Count Donepezil 10mg Once daily Long-term Oral Cognitive enhancer
PET-CT Peripheral Blood Smear Alprazolam 0.25mg As needed Short-term Oral Caution with dependency
CT Neck/Chest Lymph Node Biopsy Sertraline 50mg Once daily Long-term Oral SSRI first-line therapy
Brain MRI Coagulation Profile Fluoxetine 20mg Once daily Long-term Oral High-dose SSRI often needed
Brain MRI Thyroid Function Test Methylphenidate 10mg Once or twice daily Long-term Oral Monitor growth in children
MRI Brain with Contrast CSF Cytology Risperidone 0.5mg Once daily Long-term Oral For irritability or aggression
CT PNS Nasal Swab Culture Zolpidem 5�10mg At bedtime Short-term Oral Avoid long-term use
MRI Brain CSF Analysis CPAP + Modafinil 100mg Once daily Long-term Device/Oral Weight loss advised
EEG + MRI Brain Electrolyte Panel Pramipexole 0.25mg At bedtime Long-term Oral Dopamine agonist
MRI Brain + Spine CSF Oligoclonal Bands Modafinil 100mg Once daily Long-term Oral Supportive therapy
Abdominal CT WBC Count Amitriptyline 25mg At bedtime Long-term Oral Improves sleep and pain
Abdominal CT CA 19-9 Gabapentin 300mg Three times daily Long-term Oral Neuropathic pain control
Mammography Biopsy Histopathology Orlistat 120mg Three times daily Long-term Oral Take with meals
Chest CT Sputum Cytology Multivitamin + Protein supplements As directed Long-term Oral or NG Supportive nutrition
CT Abdomen CEA Test ORS solution 200�400ml After each stool As needed Oral or IV Depends on severity
Pelvic MRI PSA Test Normal saline / Potassium chloride Varies Until corrected IV/Oral Based on lab results
Pelvic MRI Pap Smear Silver sulfadiazine 1% cream Apply twice daily Until healed Topical Broad antimicrobial coverage
Pelvic Ultrasound CA-125 Analgesics (Paracetamol + Diclofenac) As needed Short-term Oral Immobilization required
Pelvic MRI Hormone Profile Ceftriaxone 2g + Clindamycin 600mg Every 12 hours 4�6 weeks IV Adjust based on culture
Pelvic Ultrasound LH, FSH, Testosterone Meropenem 1g + Vancomycin 1g Every 8 hours 10�14 days IV Broad-spectrum combination
Neck Ultrasound TSH, T3, T4 Supportive (Oxygen + Steroids)  Variable IV/Inhalation No specific drug; ventilation required
Thyroid Scan Thyroid Antibody Test Amoxicillin-Clavulanate 875/125 mg Every 12 hours 10�14 days Oral Add nasal saline irrigation
Neck Ultrasound TSH Test Ciprofloxacin 0.3 % drops 1 drop every hour 7�10 days Ophthalmic Avoid contact lenses
Abdominal Ultrasound H. pylori Antibody Test No drug � surgical repair    Referral to ophthalmic surgeon
Upper GI Endoscopy Stool Occult Blood Test Latanoprost 0.005 % drops 1 drop nightly Long-term Ophthalmic Monitor intraocular pressure
Liver Ultrasound HBsAg Test No specific medication    Surgical management only
Liver Fibroscan Anti-HCV Antibody Test Vitamin C 500 mg + Lutein  Long-term Oral Nutritional support
Abdominal Ultrasound Prothrombin Time Insulin + Laser photocoagulation As prescribed Long-term Subcutaneous/Procedure Glycemic control critical
Liver Ultrasound LFT Prednisolone 60 mg Once daily 7�14 days Oral/IV Early treatment improves outcome
KUB Ultrasound Urine Routine Betahistine 16 mg Three times daily 2�4 weeks Oral Vestibular exercises helpful
Skin examination (Dermatoscopy) Bacterial culture (Staphylococcus aureus) Midodrine 5 mg Three times daily Long-term Oral Symptomatic treatment
Skin biopsy (if severe) ANA, ESR, CRP Pyridostigmine 60 mg Every 6 hours Long-term Oral Add Prednisone if severe
No imaging Bacterial culture (Streptococcus, Staphylococcus) IV Immunoglobulin 0.4 g/kg/day Daily 5 days IV Plasmapheresis alternative
Chest X-ray (if infection suspected) CBC, Blood culture Supportive care + Vaccination   Supportive No antiviral available
No imaging HSV IgM/IgG, PCR Rifampicin + Dapsone + Clofazimine Monthly / Daily 6�12 months Oral WHO MDT regimen
Cardiac MRI Troponin, CRP, Viral PCR Doxycycline 100 mg Every 12 hours 14�21 days Oral Alternative � Ceftriaxone IV
MRI Brain/Spine EMG, Nerve Conduction Test Doxycycline 100 mg Every 12 hours 14 days Oral For Coxiella burnetii infection
Coronary Angiography Troponin I/T, CK-MB Doxycycline 100 mg + Rifampicin 600 mg Daily 6 weeks Oral Combination therapy
Abdominal Ultrasound Liver Function Test Doxycycline 100 mg Every 12 hours 7 days Oral Add IV penicillin if severe
Salivary gland ultrasound ANA, Anti-Ro (SSA), Anti-La (SSB) Rabies vaccine + Immunoglobulin As per schedule Post-exposure IM Wound cleaning essential
